Name: Alternate side of the street parking.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to alternate side of the street parking.
Text:
Int. No. 533
By Council Members Greenfield and Koo

..Title
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to alternate side of the street parking.
..Body

Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
	Section 1.  Subdivision a of section 19-163 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended as follows:
	� 19-163 Holiday suspensions of parking rules. a. All alternate side of the street parking rules shall be suspended on the following holidays: Christmas, Yom Kippur, Rosh Hashanah, Ash Wednesday, Holy Thursday, Good Friday, Ascension Thursday, Feast of the Assumption, Feast of All Saints, Feast of the Immaculate Conception, first two days of Succoth, Shemini Atzareth, Simchas Torah, Shevuoth, Purim, Orthodox Holy Thursday, Orthodox Good Friday, first two and last two days of Passover, the Muslim holidays of Eid Ul-Fitr and Eid Ul-Adha, Asian Lunar New Year, the Hindu festival of Diwali on the day that Lakshmi Puja is observed, the Friday following Thanksgiving, and all state and national holidays. 
	�2. 	This local law shall take effect immediately after its enactment into law.




TM
Int No 969-2012
LS# 1209-2014
4/24/14

\pard\ltrpar By Council Members Greenfield and Koo\par
\par
\v ..Title\par
\v0 A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to alternate side of the street parking.\par
\v ..Body\par
\v0\par
\pard\ltrpar\sl480\slmult1\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows\ulnone :\par
\tab Section 1.  Subdivision a of section 19-163 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended as follows:\par
\tab\'a7 19-163 Holiday suspensions of parking rules. a. All alternate side of the street parking rules shall be suspended on the following holidays: Christmas, Yom Kippur, Rosh Hashanah, Ash Wednesday, Holy Thursday, Good Friday, Ascension Thursday, Feast of the Assumption, Feast of All Saints, Feast of the Immaculate Conception, first two days of Succoth, Shemini Atzareth, Simchas Torah, Shevuoth, Purim, Orthodox Holy Thursday, Orthodox Good Friday, first two and last two days of Passover, the Muslim holidays of Eid Ul-Fitr and Eid Ul-Adha, Asian Lunar New Year, the Hindu festival of Diwali on the day that Lakshmi Puja is observed, \ul the Friday following Thanksgiving,\ulnone  and all state and national holidays. \par
\tab\'a72. \tab This local law shall take effect immediately after its enactment into law.\par
\pard\ltrpar\par
